channel.title: I need help on making a WORKING "commandlog.txt" file
channel.description:
i'm running a PK server and i'm not that much online on my server myself
some time ago i tried to DELETE the ::noclip command
and afther a while i deleted the ::noclip command i noticed the command still worked
and i didn't found in my client.java anymore
now i was asking, to make it VERY easy for me, to CREATE a commandlog.txt to see EVERY command the player's typ in... [br][size=1]Posted on: March 28, 2007, 08:47:54 AM[/size][hr]..................................

item.title: I need help on making a WORKING "commandlog.txt" file
item.dc:creator: @TheAncientScape_Own1 TheAncientScape Owner
item.description:
@TheAncientScape_Own1 wrote:

yea it worked, tyvm, only some errors but i fixed them, but i’d still like to know what the admins put in as commands, like ::item 1048 or ::pickup 1051 99999999, i had to change these commands to owner only commands… but i’d like to make them admin commands… but it’s not nececary,

TY ANYWAY

Read full topic
item.source: I need help on making a WORKING "commandlog.txt" file

item.title: I need help on making a WORKING "commandlog.txt" file
item.dc:creator: @samuraiblood2 samuraiblood2
item.description:
@samuraiblood2 wrote:

just make a simple bufferd writer and add it in the case that does the :: thing, in other words just look for customCommand(" and add a bufferd writer underneath it, its very simple and noclip is a client side command so you cant delete it, add this to get rid of it if (command.startsWith("noclip") && playerRights < 1) { appendBanned(playerName); sendMessage("You have been banned for using noclip when you logoff youll be banned"); }

Read full topic
item.source: I need help on making a WORKING "commandlog.txt" file
